item.title: The Political Economy of Interdependence and Domestic Monetary Relations: Still and Extraordinary Power: America's Role in the Global Monetary System (Paper 3) (with discussants section)
item.description: Book Chapter: A paper delivered to a conference on international monetary relations. As well as considering power in the financial markets, Strange also makes a provisional (in light of her later work) analysis of structural power in the international political economy more generally. This analysis therefore widens out from an initial discussion of power in a specific sector (here the financial system) to examine the power of the U.S. more generally.
